name: The Westin Copley Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin for two nights in October of 2007 for parent’s weekend at Northeastern University. Quite frankly a hotel cannot get any better then this. The facility is immaculate, the location is great, and the staff is wonderful. The entire first and second floors are comprised of high end shops, restaurants, and a bar. In the sitting area are comfy couches and a fireplace. There is a huge business center and conference rooms on I think the third floor and on the fifth floor is a tremendous work out facility along with an indoor pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: When is Boston-Stay at the Westin!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very well appointed and are large for a city hotel. The mattresses are the heavenly sleeper you hear so much about and they were great. Lots of attention to detail right from having lots and lots of electrical outlets to having a heated fog free mirror in the bath room. Windows covered two walls, and the views were spectacular. If possible try and get a room as high up as you can for the views.
reviews.title: Very Nice Boston Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin is across the street from the Pru Center and related shopping (including a grocery store). The area is totally safe, very active on the street at night, and very accessible to and from all parts of the City via mass transit. Cabs were very easy to get at the hotels entrance.
reviews.title: Good accomodations - Outstanding Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a tremendous rate of $150 through Priceline for our stay at this facility. We had heard through the grapevine that Boston is a very Priceline friendly city, and we are very glad we tried that service. Hopefully we will get the Westin again some day!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great Location and Staff!

likes.liked: — indoor pool and hot tub was great, bed comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend the Westin to even the most demanding guest. It is simply a wonderful place to stay in Boston. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: 10-7-07 Pretty Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great last minute deal on our room from hotwire. We were only staying for one night but we may as well have just pulled an all-nighter and skipped paying for the room! Upon arrival we were quickly checked into a room on the 13th floor. The room seemed clean upon first inspection however I noticed that the bed had numerous hairs on the sheets leaving me to wonder whether or not the sheets were even changed. Also, the bathroom had a terribly chipped toilet and finger nail clippings on the floor.
reviews.title: Great location but wouldn't stay again...

likes.disliked: — noise, condition of the bathroom, cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The view from the room was great. It was front facing the John Hancock building. That was about the only plus! The hotel was incredibly noisy and I'm not referring to the other guests! In fact, I never even heard anyone else talking in the hotel, the other guests were very quiet. However, the pipes in this place were ridiculous! They knocked all night and rattled everytime someone down the hall flushed the toilet or turned on the sink. In the morning, the housekeeper turned the vacuum on down the hall at about 7am and continued until about 11am going into various rooms. There was also an alarm going off in the hotel for a half an hour! I've never been in such a noisy hotel.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Maybe I was just there on a really bad night but it really skewed my view of the Westin!
reviews.title: think twice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights for a long weekend. Managed to book a cheap rate via priceline.com for 1st night as the rest of the stay was for business.
reviews.title: Gets a 5 based on Value

likes.disliked: — high pitched noise on 12th floor in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Check in: Fine
reviews.title: Boston's Best ! The Westin Copley!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're interested in staying at this hotel you understand this is not a discount hotel property. You might however think the Westin name and the corporate standards around that name will provide some guarantees of quality, service and fairness in pricing. You might not be impressed.
reviews.title: Nice hotel.... but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: For starters -- the hotel is well located, generally in good condition and the staff want to be helpful. But it does seem like the finance department is really the ones running the hotel and they have found virtually every little way they can to get more money out of your pocket and into theirs. Does anybody else remember a time when you booked a hotel room, you might pay a 50 or 100 per uplift/surcharge for using the phone, and the restaurants and gift shops were only nominally more expensive than the general area? What happened to those days?
reviews.title: Good hotel with pleasant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The significant other and I selected the Westin based on location and availability for a quick five and a half day (long) weekend around Labor Day 2007. We booked a "standard" room, and showed up late in the evening of our designated arrival. So far -- no problems.
reviews.title: Loved the Copley Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being that it was late (approaching midnight), we decided to order a quick bite for dinner. We know that room service isn't cheap but being tired and hungry and unwilling to go forage for food in a new town at a late hour we ordered away - one steak quesadilla, one shrimp cocktail and two sodas. Now I wasn't expecting to get this at Taco Bell prices, but when I saw the room service ticket and they wanted me to pay $56.00 I was really unhappy. In all fairness the shrimp (4) were larger than my thumb and the meal was presented with a sprig of parsley. But 8 oz bottles of soda for $4.50 each, a mandatory gratuity, a delivery charge, a convention tax and another miscellaneous fee or two ran a ridiculous bill into the a whole new level.
reviews.title: Westin Copley Place - good hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: A trip to the front desk the next morning got an apology from the room service manager (who double checked that they hadn't made a billing error) for the above average prices. I repeated my displeasure and vowed to not use that service again during our stay. When we returned to the room that evening there was a hand written note, a tray of cheese wedges and some crackers and a bottle of "designer" water repeating the apology.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Stay I've Ever Had!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was in Boston for a conference. It was my first time spending any real amount of time in a major city. I was very impressed with what I saw of Boston. I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights and I was very impressed with the hotel. It was incredibly clean and quite upscale.
reviews.title: Great City, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was able to walk to the Hynes Convention Center without going outdoors by way of a walkway between hotels and buildings that even extends over streets.
reviews.title: Great...when you're not paying!

likes.liked: — Upscale feel to the whole experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was decent -- not great but decent. The gym on the fifth floor was far above average for any other hotel that I've ever stayed at. They had many (8-12) treadmills, free weights, and numerous machines.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness, and ease of check-in and check-out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night I stopped at the concierge desk to ask about a good place to go for a run. They had laminated maps for 3 and file mile loops around the Charles River. I didn't really even expect to get a good answer much less a printed map.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — High Price of Room service, even more then most hotel markups for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a 100 strong group of 'Achievers' from my company...all expenses paid! We had a UK based travel team looking after us so they took care of all arrangements and as a result I didn't have much need to call on Hotel's own staff. Great hotel with great highrise views. Those Westin beds are amazing, almost worth the $10,000 you can buy them for from the in-room catalogue (add a bottle of Westin fragrance and a Westin shower to complete the experience at home!!). The breakfasts should not be missed, especially the breakfast bagels.
reviews.title: A First Class Experience

likes.liked: — The location, the breakfasts and the excellent staff
likes.disliked: — The fact that we did not stay longer. Can't wait to go back!

description: Our Boston Hotel features a great location and comforting accommodations. The Westin Copley Place is linked to the Hynes Convention Center and is only a stroll away from Boston's best shopping.
